description: From Middle French indisposer, equivalent to in- +â€Ž dispose.

verbs.description: indispose (third-person singular simple present indisposes, present participle indisposing, simple past and past participle indisposed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To render unfit or unsuited; to disqualify.
(transitive) To make indisposed, or slightly unwell.

examples: A love of pleasure indisposes the mind to severe study.
